notes: Free, postage-paid Mail Back envelopes can be found on display in the lobby. There is no limit to the number of envelopes customers may take. The contents of the envelope must weigh less than 13 ounces and the envelope must be able to seal completely. For more details visitMaxBack."

name: Call2Recycle at Office Depot
materials: Cell Phones; Ni-Cd Batteries; Li-Ion Batteries; Ni-MH Batteries; Ni-Zn Batteries; Small Sealed Lead Acid Batteries; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: The U.S. EPA estimates that more than 350 million rechargeable batteries are purchased annually in the U.S. Thanks to the environmental commitment of this location, its easy and free to recycle your batteries. Bring your rechargeable batteries to this location and look for the recycling box or ask an associate how you can do your part for the environment.

name: Call2Recycle at RadioShack
materials: Cell Phones; Ni-Cd Batteries; Li-Ion Batteries; Ni-MH Batteries; Ni-Zn Batteries; Small Sealed Lead Acid Batteries; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: As the first national retailer to partner with Call2Recycle, RadioShack is at the forefront of the rechargeable battery recycling cause and is pleased to offer battery recycling at thousands of convenient RadioShack locations for free.  Simply drop them off at your local RadioShack and theyll take care of the rest.  Ask a store associate for more details.

name: Habitat for Humanity ReStore
hours: Wednesday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM Thursday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM Friday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM Saturday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM
materials: Carpet; Carpet Padding; Ceiling Tiles; Ceramic Tiles; Construction Materials (Reuse); Linoleum; Porcelain; Reusable Appliance Donation; Roofing Materials; Miscellaneous Tools; Windows; Wood; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: This site is located across from the Fairgrounds.  The ReStore raises funds by selling merchandise and uses all profits to build more homes.  Habitat also provides families an opportunity to buy building materials that they may not otherwise be able to afford. This will help raise the standards of housing. By recycling goods that would have been sent to a landfill, the ReStore also helps reduce waste disposal costs. If you have materials to donate, please call for more information. The Habitat ReStore takes most materials and the staff will be glad to talk with you.
